entries.meaning: The condition of being a fool; foolishness; folly
examples: The devil on your foolship! — Oh, I must walk the dark foggy way that spits fire and brimstone.

entries.meaning: (often humorous) Used as a title or a form of address for a foolish person
examples: To this Philip replied, “We give your Foolship to know that in temporals we are subject to no person.”
